> Within an hour, I should have my scenario converter able to read the 
> scenario files and put them in a text file.

Finished that.  Right now, I am working on producing more 
user-friendly output for the user to edit.  For example, instead of 
listing order and family numbers, I list the object type.

My program will be a converter of scenario 
information/text-based scenario editor.  The converter is putting out 
information in the exact same format as the current scenario 
converter, but the text-based scenario editor will be done 
differently.

There are some gaps in information which I am filling with guesses 
(two specific cases in the commands: what is command 0 and command 
255?  I found those listed in a converted file.)

I do believe somebody probably needs to take on the project of 
converting the scenario specifications file into something more 
readible, perhaps a system of web pages explaining the information: a 
main page with the bare bones information and pages linked to it 
explaining the details.
